DOC.brief_summary: Specific Aim: Test the hypothesis that ocular light exposure will suppress melatonin secretion and reduce uterine contractions in women at late term pregnancies. Secondary aim. Test the hypothesis that ocular light exposure will reduce self-reported uterine contractions in women at late term pregnancies.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Light on Melatonin and Contractions in Pregnant Women
DOC.criteria: pregnant at 3540 weeks first pregnancy pregnancyrelated complications twin or higher pregnancy using medication that affects the sympathetic nervous system
